job_title: Saturday Art School Assistant in Bournemouth, England
pros: I worked here while studying. It was great to fit around my study schedule and a lovely supportive environment.
cons: Not many hours as it is just Saturdays.

pros: - Good support from Student Services - Working on final project in teams which is required in industry
cons: - Huge workload - Would be helpful to record lectures especially for those who struggle with learning difficulties

pros: - Networking opportunties. - Very flexible job. No pressure to accept any shifts at any point of your study duration. - Exposure to all of the university resources which often go may go unnoticed. - Practicing public-speaking. - Help lost potential university students in their journey to select their fields.
cons: - Not much to complain about it except for the schedule issue for this role. It would very beneficial to have a program dedicated to the student ambassadors where they can review their scheduled work shifts and allocate sections where one can sign off their completed shifts.

pros:
Creative environment, lots of studios and equipment to experiment and test out ideas. 
The campus itself is fantastic and very work friendly. I was fortunate to work with a great team of people. 
Flexibility in work schedules where needed. 
Good professional development opportunities for learning new skills, gaining new qualifications, etc.
cons:
At times, a seemingly unequal and opaque promotion structure. 
Insufficient capacity in certain departments.
However, these can be quite common complaints in any larger organisation..

job_title: Access and Participation Manager in Bournemouth, England
pros: Some great people who keep the place running

- Nice colleagues and friendly atmosphere.
- Flexible and family friendly nature of job.
- A new leader with a great vision trying to set things right.
cons:
- outdated systems and procedures
- lack of internal control
- pay is not great.
- not big on staff training and development
- opportunities for career growth is very limited

pros: A very relaxed and calm environment

review_title: Great camaraderie and a good place to grow professionally.
pros: You are working with the best, good studios and eqipment. Everyone is there to help each other out. Artistic minds will bloom there.
cons: Not many cons, most to do with pandemic restrictions. But thinking out of the box is what the department does best.

job_title: Casual Film Technician in Bournemouth, England
pros: Very flexible hours. Able to pick and choose the days you can work.
cons: It is casual work. Hours are not guaranteed.

review_title: University won't change with the times
pros: Working alongside creative like-minded people, campus is well designed, fairly modern and close to Bournemouth beach and gardens.
cons: Content of some courses have remained the same over a period of 10 years, so students are taught outdated practices that are not reflective of the current industry. Incredibly tight budgets place unrealistic demands on staff lower down the salary chain. Higher management will not pay for staff development. Very limited opportunities for career progression. Health & safety for staff is not always prioritised. It can take an accident or sickness due to working conditions before the university will act, and that's primarily out of fear of being sued. Technical staff are not treated equally by other staff because of their job roles. Staff are told to pander to students because of the money they bring to the university £££; The university is scared of the NSS (National Student Survey).

job_title: Art Education Specialist in Bournemouth, England
pros: Since completing an MA at AUB doors have opened to me and many opportunities have come my way. I have recently returned from Beijing where I represented AUB on an International Educational Development Programme with the British Council. The support and encouragement I received in order to do this role was amazing. AUB had total belief in me and my abilities.
cons: I don' t have anything negative to say about AUB

job_title: Course Leader and Lecturer in Bournemouth, England
pros: Brilliantly creative environment where anything feels possible!

review_title: Nice place to work. Compact campus and friendly atmosphere
